snippet: The seminary’s president says the money from the sale is needed to bring the campus’s crumbling structures up to code, but faculty members and students say the plan presents a moral quandary.
abstract: The Appraisal column; plan by Union Theological Seminary in Harlem to sell air rights to developer to finance $150 million campus renovation has drawn condemnation from both students and faculty; critics say plan to build luxury condominiums on site will exacerbate effects of gentrification and runs counter to seminary's mission to protect rights of poor.
lead_paragraph: The seminary’s president says the money from the sale is needed to bring the campus’s crumbling structures up to code, but faculty members and students say the plan presents a moral quandary.

headline.print_headline: Fearing a Mission’s Betrayal as a Seminary Plans to Sell Its Air Rights
headline.main: Fearing a Mission’s Betrayal as Union Theological Seminary Plans to Sell Its Air Rights
